compact.translation[0].definitions[0].de: small, but arranged so that everything fits neatly into the space available – used to show approval
compact.translation[0].definitions[0].ex: The compact design of the machine allows it to be stored easily.
The students’ rooms were compact, with a desk, bed, and closet built in.
compact.translation[0].definitions[1].de: packed or put together firmly and closely
compact.translation[0].definitions[1].ex: The bushes grew in a compact mass.
compact.translation[1].definitions[0].de: a small flat container with a mirror, containing powder for a woman’s face
compact.translation[1].definitions[3].de: an agreement between countries or people
compact.translation[1].definitions[3].ex: A compact was negotiated between the company and the union.
compact.translation[2].definitions[0].de: to press something together so that it becomes smaller or more solid
